alert.note: Alert for Des Moines; Henry (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 04 at 2:45PM CDT until June 04 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Henry County in southeastern Iowa... Northwestern Des Moines County in southeastern Iowa... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 244 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Yarmouth, or 10 miles east of Mount Pleasant, moving west at 15 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Mount Union around 250 PM CDT. New London around 300 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Mount Pleasant Municipal Arpt, Mount Pleasant and Henry County Fairgrounds. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning.
